fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
If the Atlassian account language is set to Spanish, the Jira Cloud for Sheets won’t recognize the Issue Type *Tarea* (Task) when you try to Get issues from Jira.
 !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail! 
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Change the Atlassian account language to Spanish
 # Open the Jira Cloud for Sheets add-on on Google Sheets
 # Click on *Get issues from Jira* > select *Tarea* in *Issue Types*

h3. Expected Results
It will bring all the Tarea (Task) issues.
h3. Actual Results
An error saying that the Tarea doesn’t exist for the field 'ISSUETYPE'.

h3. Workaround
 Change the Atlassian account language to English
fields.summary: Jira Cloud for Sheets - Issue Type Error When Using Jira In Spanish

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Users are reporting some filter subscriptions are sending duplicate e-mails. This can happen if a user has already received the notification but the job that sends the email subsequently fails to complete successfully, with this, the job will restart and send the emails again even to users that already received the email.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Subscribe to a filter
# Wait for the time set for the filter subscription to be sent

h3. Expected Results
Jira will send just 1 email for the filter subscribed.

h3. Actual Results
Jira will send more than 1 email for the same filter subscribed.

h3. Workaround
Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Filter Subscription Sending Duplicate Emails

fields.description:
h3. Problem
The API https://domain.atlassian.net/rest/api/3/project/search?orderBy=+lastIssueUpdatedTime does not work, using the (+ or - sign or the default does not work for sorting ). The project list returns but sorting by the updated time for the last issue does not work

h3. Environment
JSoftware
.

 Steps to Reproduce
* Use the API query - The API https://domain.atlassian.net/rest/api/3/project/search?orderBy=+lastIssueUpdatedTime
* update an issue in the project
* This issue should be listed at the bottom

h3. Expected Results
https://domain.atlassian.net/rest/api/3/project/search?orderBy=+lastIssueUpdatedTime ( this should list in the ascending order by the last issue updated time.
h3. Actual Results
https://domain.atlassian.net/rest/api/3/project/search?orderBy=+lastIssueUpdatedTime ( this should list in the ascending order)- No sorting happens
h3. Workaround
_(Add a workaround, if available)_

h3. Notes
Looks like a bug
fields.summary: API does not work for orderBy to get the project list for lastIssueUpdatedTime in the ASC or DES order

fields.description:
Workflow viewer and editor should show clear transition lines and status placement after migration to the cloud.

!image-2021-11-08-17-10-46-757.png|width=142,height=71!
h3. Workaround

The workflow congestion has to be manually removed by navigating to each workflow and dragging the statuses & transitions away from each other.
fields.summary: Workflow viewer should show the clear transition lines and status placement after migration to cloud

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Typing the shortcut (! ) in the new issue view does not show the emoji image but remains the typed shortcut.
The shortcut is intentionally typed with space for visibility.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
# In the description or comment of an issue type a shortcut for waring emoji (! ).
# The shortcut will be shown instead of the image.
# Typing :warning: will show the image but the shortcut (! ) will not.

h3. Expected Results
After typing the shortcut (! ) the warning emoji icon should appear.

h3. Actual Results
The warning emoji icon does not appear and the shortcut text (! ) remains unformatted.

h3. Workaround
Type *:warning:* shortcut instead of the (! ) shortcut.

 !Screen Shot 2021-11-08 at 11.58.01.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Typing Jira emoji warning shortcut (!) does not show the emoji icon.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Currently, the JQL function "membersOf" is valid only when used with the user groups. It should be possible to search for the users belonging to a "Team" (People section) using this function. 

This would be useful while configuring automation that searches for users who are part of a Team. 
h3. Workaround

The workaround for this would be to create a _Group_ with the same members of the _Team_ and add that _Group_ in the JQL while configuring the Automation.
fields.summary: The JQL function "membersOf" is valid only when used with the user Groups.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

It's not possible to customize colors in Created x Resolved gadget.
h3. Expected Results

It should be possible to customize colors. This might be necessary, for example, to improve color perception.
h3. Actual Results

It's only possible to change the color of the board of the gadget.
h3. Workaround

It's possible to use browser extension to improve color perception experience.
fields.summary: Allow customized colors to be set for Created vs Resolved gadget

fields.description:
When I want to select a Watcher and type the name in the field, only the full name is shown and the email address isn't. 

This makes it hard to identify colleagues with identical names.

 I would like to request the email address and job title / department to be displayed when selecting a Watcher.

!image-2021-11-05-16-49-24-250.png!
fields.summary: Display email address when searching for Watchers

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When accessing the Custom Fields via Settings (Issues -> Custom Fields) some locked fields (*Flagged, Development, Issue color, Rank, Start date*) are shown associated with screens that don’t match any existing screens for company-managed projects. When clicking on the screens, it redirects to a 500 error page.

+It seems to be affecting only Team-Managed Projects+.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Access custom fields
# Fetch for any of the fields mentioned above
# Click at the screens from the field
# You will visualize some screens named similar to an issue key
# Click on it and it will be redirected to a 500 error page

h3. Expected Results
The custom field should display all screens associated with it correctly, not the screens that don't match any existing screens.

h3. Actual Results
When clicking at the screens named similar to an issue key, it redirects to a 500 error page like the following images.
 !image-2021-11-05-11-27-31-903.png|thumbnail! 
 !image-2021-11-05-11-24-53-820.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround
Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: When accessing Custom Fields via Settings, some locked fields have screens associated that redirect to a 500 Internal Server Error page

fields.description:
We would like to have a line in the burndown chart that would represent the total of hours worked.
This way we can can comparison between the work that was done and how much time was needed to accomplish it.
fields.summary: Add "time spent" in the burndown chart

fields.description:
h3. Summary
There are some PDF files that aren't able to be previewed in Jira Cloud. So far we have noticed it happens to some files generated from Docusign.

h3. Expected Results
PDF Preview is generated
 !screenshot-2.png|thumbnail! 
 !screenshot-4.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Actual Results
Preview isn't generated
 !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail! 
 !screenshot-3.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Notes
This issue has been already been reported this to our engineering team to improve the PDF preview capability in the new editor.

h3. Workaround
A known workaround is to open the file in a different PDF editor, save the file and re-upload.
fields.summary: PDF preview isn't working for some files

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

 The "Create Linked Issue" (available in JWM)does not have an option not to copy Agile data. Beside the option not to copy all the Agile data, the user would also like an option to choose which field values that they can copy. For example, the user would like the option to choose which Sprint values that the new issue should contain. This is important since creating a new issue which is associated to completed Sprint is causing inconsistency.
h3. Suggested Solution

Add option during issue creation using "Create Linked Issue" so the user can choose which field values that should be retained.
h3. Workaround

Create issue manually and link the issue
fields.summary: Allow "Create Linked Issue" to copy only Active Sprints.

fields.description: Include field context changes to the audit log to find out what it has been changed and who changed it.
fields.summary: Include field context changes to audit log

fields.description: Ability to turn off the notification when a label is edited (change/add/remove). Currently, a notification is sent to everyone.
fields.summary: Ability to turn off the notification when a label is edited

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

The new desktop Teams app makes it possible to communicate with Jira in many ways. However, there are a few instances where the app shows a blank screen with no apparent errors or reasons why it failed.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Download the Microsoft Teams for Jira app
 # Sign in to your account with your credentials
 # Connect to your Jira instance
 # Try to set up the notifications to finalize the configuration

h3. Expected Results

The configuration should be completely set up appropriately
h3. Actual Results

The configuration page just shows a blank screen with no error.
 !blank.png|width=208,height=292!
h3. Workaround
 * There seems to be an issue with the cache and in some cases by signing out of the Teams app and logging in again, repeating the entire configuration set seems to resolve the problem.
fields.summary: Blank screen shown on Microsoft Teams for Jira

fields.description:
Need a way to dynamically iterate component values like we have the functionality for lookup issues.
It will be good to have lookup components as well
or where we can give an API endpoint to get the project components as explained in https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/jira/platform/rest/v3/api-group-project-components/#api-rest-api-3-project-projectidorkey-component-get
fields.summary: Need automation functionality to lookup component values

fields.description:
Summary
The dashboard gadget "Average Time in Status" only pertains to issues that are already resolved. 
The gadget does not cater to issues that are not yet resolved.

Request to create a gadget that shows average in time in a specific status for non-resolved issues. 

How to Replicate
* Login to cloud instance
* Access Jira product > Dashboard > Add the gadget "Average Time in Status"
* Configure the gadget with the appropriate status (in this case, Selected for Development)
* Click the graph create, and you will see the JQL is always in this status/time format:
“project = xxxx AND resolved >= 2021-11-04 AND resolved <= "2021-11-04 23:59"
 
With the above example, if you have the following: 
3 resolved/done issues
3 issues still under “Selected for Development” workflow

See pic 1 for reference. 

The gadget will only show 3 issues, it only shows issues that went through 'Selected for Development' workflow but now are resolved. It does not count the issues that went through 'Selected for Development' status but are not yet resolved. 
See pic 2 for reference.
See pic 3 for reference.
fields.summary: Jira Dashboard: gadget that shows Average in Time Status for issues that are still in UNRESOLVED status

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When you transition an issue with a multi-select field on the transition screen, once selecting the options and focusing on another field, the selection is not shown in the field and stays as if nothing was selected.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a multi-select custom field and add it to the Transition screen of a workflow
 # Transiton an issue to a status that has the transition screen
 # On the transition screen, select multiple values on the multi-select field
 # Change the page focus to another field

h3. Expected Results

The selected options should remain highlighted to display which options are selected.
h3. Actual Results

There are no highlighted options unless the page focus goes back to the multi-select field, which makes the selected options highlighted again.

This is what I have on our side. The web browser picks the grey color from the option:checked because it has the !important tag.
 !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail! 
However, on customers' web browsers, they don't have the !important tag, so the web browser picks the other color (white) making it hard to distinguish visually the selected options but they still are selected.
 !screenshot-2.png|thumbnail! 
h3. Workaround

No workaround. This is only a visibility issue as the options selected remain saved if the issue is transitioned.
fields.summary: When using a multiselect on a Transition screen the selection disappears on losing field focus

fields.description:
As an admin, you may not want users to use all the features of Jira Cloud for Slack. For example, you may want to restrict the feature to create issues from Slack because you want them to be created only from Jira.
It would be great to have the ability to decide which features to enable in Jira Cloud for Slack.
fields.summary: Jira Cloud for Slack - Restrictions on the use of features

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When copying text with URLs from Confluence to Jira, if the text is in bold style, the URLs are converted to plain text, without the hyperlinks.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
* Type a line of text in a Jira comment/description or confluence page
* Bold the line
* Make the text a link (select and paste a link or use the link tool)
* Copy the text
* Paste the text into a Jira comment or description or rich text field

h3. Expected Results
The URL text should be copied as URL, but it's copied as plain text.

h3. Actual Results

The text is copied as plain text, the hyperlink is removed.

h3. Workaround

Remove the bold style from the text and then try pasting it again.
fields.summary: Pasting bold linked text copied from jira/confluence does not retain link

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When a Date Picker custom field is named with special character "&", editing on the old view, the custom field name is formatted as 
{code:borderStyle=solid}
&
{code}

 !image-2021-11-03-17-29-29-982.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a custom field of type Date Picker
# Name it and include some with the character '&' present
# Save it and add to a screen

h3. Expected Results
The custom field is named correctly and displayed: "Named&Correctly"

h3. Actual Results
The custom field is named correctly, however, when editing the issue, the name is formatted as 
{code:borderStyle=solid}
Named&Correctly
{code}

h3. Workaround
Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A possible workaround is to use the new view where you can edit the fields from the issue view.
fields.summary: When editing an issue on the old view, Date Picker custom field named with special character "&" displays "amp;"

fields.description: Ability to have a hierarchical relationship between Initiative and Epic without using Advanced Roadmaps, identical to the Parent-child relationship between Epics and Stories, where you can see all the stories under it and easily Add, edit, delete stories from the Epic.
fields.summary: Ability to have a hierarchical relationship between Initiative and Epic without using Advanced Roadmaps

fields.description: It would be helpful to have the option to 'like' a status update on a Jira ticket to show another user that you have seen their update.
fields.summary: Ability to 'like' status updates on Jira tickets

fields.description: As a feature for Jira, it would be nice to have Teams automatically removed from issues once this Team is deleted from the Advanced Roadmaps menu.
fields.summary: Remove Teams from Issues once the Team is deleted

fields.description: As a user, I want the ability to be able to format text contained within a table and align them to either the left, right or centre of the cell. Currently, this is not possible as each text is always aligned to the left side of the cell.
fields.summary: Ability to align text on a table in multi-line fields

fields.description:
h3. Summary :

Currently the export tries to ensure that there is a "sysadmin" user in the database. If it is not there then it creates one. 

user_key is used to see if there is a user with user key= 'sysadmin'. When a user is created with the username *sysadmin*, an entry is added to the *app_user* table with the user_key as *sysadmin*.

The problem occurs when you this 'sysadmin' username is changed. Post which, when you try to generate a backup it fails as during the backup process a dummy user *sysadmin* and an entry into the app_user table is also added to this *sysadmin* user, as there's already an entry for the other user that changed its name, the export fails.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a user with the username as *sysadmin*. (Since you cannot specify a username on the user's creation, you can set the user's email as sysadmin@.... as the username is always the content before the '@' on the email, hence, the user would be created as *sysadmin*)
 # Change the username of this newly created user to anything else.
 # Try to generate a backup

h3. Expected Results

The backup is generated successfully.
h3. Actual Results

The export process fails with the following error:
{code:java}
Export error

Export failed (Starting export)

Please try again later or contact support if error persists.
{code}
On the logs, we can find the following error:
{code:java}
 msg: SQL Exception while executing the following:INSERT INTO public.app_user (ID, user_key, lower_user_name) VALUES (?, ?, ?) (ERROR: duplicate key value violates unique constraint "uk_lower_user_name"
  Detail: Key (lower_user_name)=(sysadmin) already exists.)
     stack: org.ofbiz.core.entity.GenericDataSourceException: SQL Exception while executing the following:INSERT INTO public.app_user (ID, user_key, lower_user_name) VALUES (?, ?, ?) (ERROR: duplicate key value violates unique constraint "uk_lower_user_name"
  Detail: Key (lower_user_name)=(sysadmin) already exists.)
{code}
fields.summary: Backup for server which fails when an user is created with the username - sysadmin and this is changed.

fields.description:
After the release of the Admin announcement banner in the cloud, the most asked for feature was addition of rich formatting and the ability to add links in the banner. This ticket tracks that feature request.
h3. Current Behavior.

Announcement Banners can only contain plain text
h3. Desired Behavior.

Announcement Banners can contain hyperlinks and rich formatting: bold, italic, various font sizes and colors
fields.summary: Add rich text formatting to the admin announcement banner in Jira Cloud

fields.description:
The ability to hide options on the left sidebar for Business projects so that unused items do not clutter the view. The ability to hide options such as;
 * Calendar
 * Timeline
 * Forms
 * Project settings (hide for non-admin users)

 

!Screen Shot 2021-11-03 at 11.25.34 am.png!
fields.summary: Ability to hide left sidebar options in Business projects

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Some customers aren't showing up inside the customer organisation in the customer's section. If you search them through email, they show up with the organisation right beside their names, however, going into the organisation you cannot see them.

Effectively, they are members of the organisation, but not visible through the UI.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Go to a JSM project;
# On the left sidebar go to customers;
# Select an organisation;

h3. Expected Results
The customers should be visible inside the organisation.

h3. Actual Results
Some customers don't show up inside the organisation, they are only searchable through the customer's page.

h3. Workaround
Contact [Atlassian Support|https://support.atlassian.com/] informing this bug.
fields.summary: Some customers aren't showing up inside the customer organisation

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When creating an issue that has a Select List (multiple choices) field, once selecting the options and focusing on another field the selection is not shown in the field and it stays as if nothing was selected.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a multi-select custom field and add it to the Creation screen
 # Click on Create to create a new issue
 # Select multiple values on the multi select field
 # Change the page focus to another field

h3. Expected Results

The selected options should remain highlighted to display which options are selected.

h3. Actual Results

There are no highlighted options unless the page focus goes back to the multi select field which then makes the selected options highlighted again.

h3. Workaround
In Firefox : The selections remains highlighted, so using Firefox could be a workaround.
In Chrome or Chromium based browsers : No workaround at this point. PS : This is only a visibility issue as the options selected remain saved if the issue is created.
fields.summary: When using a Select List (multiple choices)on the Create screen the selection disappears on losing field focus

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Currently, if you have a high number of users and try to query them using the /rest/api/3/users with pagination, you may find that some users appear to be duplicated or missing.

The reason for this behavior is lack of ordering in the output, for each page the database is free to return results in any order, and then return the page, which may cause the behavior described.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Suppose you have 200 users and you want to find *User A*
 # Query users with the /rest/api/3/users endpoint while setting maxResults to a number that could give you at least two or three pages of results

h3. Expected Results

*User A* will appear exactly one time on one of the pages
h3. Actual Results
 - Possible Result #1: *User A* will not appear on any of the pages
 - Possible Result #2: *User A* will appear exactly one time on more than one pages
 - Possible Result #3: *User A* will appear exactly one time on one of the pages

h3. Workaround

User a higher number of maxResults in order to eliminate the need for pagination. (This may not be possible in some cases)
fields.summary: Users duplicated/missing when paginating results from /rest/api/3/users endpoint

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When an issue doesn't have watched the eyeball icon is top aligned. 
It is only centered when there is a watch count present

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Open an issue with no Watchers
# The eyeball icon is top aligned

h3. Expected Results
The eyeball icon should be centered aligned like the other icons

h3. Actual Results
The eyeball icon is top aligned

h3. Workaround
Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Watch eyeball icon is top aligned in new issue view

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When using the Issue Navigator in the *List View*, fields and their values are displayed in the old issue view causing functionalities like smart links to not work since it still uses the old view logic.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Update the *Description* field of an issue and add the URL and issue key of any issue (eg. https://host.atlassian.net/browse/ISSUE-5 and ISSUE-5)
# Go to the Issue Navigator and switch to the *List View*
# Search for the issue you've updated and include the *Description* field in the columns

h3. Expected Results

The smart link will kick in and convert the URL and issue key into a card. Below is the issue details which should be displayed the same.

 !_TST7-462__TEST_-_Jira.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Actual Results

Instead, we see the raw unformatted URL (including the issue key version)

 !list_view.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround

Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. 

The only known alternative would be to use the old issue view and insert just the issue key which triggers the smart link on both views as well as in the Issue Navigator as shown below.

Adding the issue key in the new view won't work unless you avoid adding a space to trigger the smart link but then you're faced with JRACLOUD-75855.

 !list_view_with_issue_key.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Issue Navigator uses old issue view causing smart links not to work

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When an automation rule for Team-managed projects includes actions for the parent issue key, (normally relates to subtasks) then the automation fails because the parent key is not retrieved by the automation.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create an automation rule with the *For Parent* branch like the below example.

 !image-2021-10-19-11-58-38-163.png|thumbnail! 
h3. Expected Results

No error found, and the automation rule runs successfully.
h3. Actual Results

In Audit Log, *some errors* are thrown:
h5. _{color:#00875a}[Branch rule / related issues|https://upstartnetwork.atlassian.net/plugins/servlet/ac/com.codebarrel.addons.automation/cb-jira-automation-rules#!/rule/2470039/64744959]{color}_

_{color:#00875a}Error searching for related issues. This is most likely because the following issues don't have a related issue of the type you specified. Try narrowing your search to only include issues that contain links to related issues:{color}_

_{color:#00875a}IssueKey-xxxx: "(key =) AND (project in (xxxx))" - Error in JQL Query: Expecting either a value, list or function but got ')'. You must surround ')' in quotation marks to use it as a value. (line 1, character 7){color}_
h3. Workaround

Currently, there is no known workaround for this behaviour. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: When an automation rule for Team-managed projects includes actions for parent issue key, automation fails with Error in JQL Query: Expecting either a value, list or function but got ')'

fields.description:
Hi Team,

In fields like "Assignee", "Reporter", "Requestor" we have our users displayed in form "FirstName LastName". We would like to have an option to display users in "LastName, FirstName" format, as it will help to sort user's by last name.
fields.summary: Ability to sort users by lastname, firstname

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Issues in Epic field are not seen in IOS app.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Find an Epic with associated issues (“Issues in Epic” section is visible).

 # Remove the “Epic Name” field from the screen

 # Close and re-open the issue

h3. Expected Results

Issues in Epic” section should be visible
h3. Actual Results

“Issues in Epic” section disappears
h3. Workaround

Add the “Epic Name” field for the screen.
fields.summary: IOS - Issues in epic do not show up on the app.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Dashboard Viewers reverts back to Private regardless of Public being selected
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a dashboard open to the Public:
 !image-2021-11-02-15-28-00-873.png|width=286,height=268!
 # Click Edit and Share, notice it has reverted to Private:
 !image-2021-11-02-15-28-28-700.png|width=309,height=157!
 # Set Viewers to Public, notice it reverts back to Private:
 !image-2021-11-02-15-29-16-925.png|width=1447,height=38!

h3. Expected Results

The Viewers setting should respect the setting chosen
h3. Actual Results

It keeps on reverting back to Private
h3. Workaround

None
fields.summary: Dashboard Viewers reverts back to Private regardless of Public being selected

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When black text from an email or the like is added to an issue the app is set to dark mode the text is not visible

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Step 1 - Copy and paste black text from an email and add it to the description of a JSM issue
 # Step 2 - Switch iOS app to dark mode

h3. Expected Results

# Text is rendered and visible
h3. Actual Results

# Text is invisible
h3. Workaround

 # Change app to light mode by tapping account in upper left -> Settings -> Theme
 # Copy text and adjust colour
fields.summary: Text from HTML is rendered black in dark mode

fields.description:
Rules that are really long are cumbersome to work with — you have to scroll all the way down to your component, click on it, and then scroll all the way back up. For rules with lots of components, this is almost untenable.

Potential solutions are:
* Fixing the config panel to the window while the component list scrolls
* Scrolling the two panels separately
* Jumping to the top of the page when a component is selected
* Ability to collapse long rule branches in the side bar
fields.summary: Automation: Better UX handling for long rules

fields.description:
When applying an Automation rule to Jira for mulitple projects this set the rule as Global.

However only Jira Admins can update the Global rules.

It would be good if for any of the projects that are in scope for the rule, where a user is a project Administrator, that they have the option to update the rule. 

e.g.

To set/remove any project's they administer in the rules scope, 

To edit the triggers/conditions/actions for the rule (the rule audit capture who made the change and when). 

the audit is visible to Jira Admins or any other "in scope" project admins for transparency of changes made.

This would enable, for example, where we have multiple JSM projects suing the same rules on each project, to be able to use a shared rule across those service desks. The project Admins can manage one rule (or set of rules) across all their service desk projects. Instead of having to add a new rule into each project individually.
fields.summary: Allow Project Administrators to edit Global rules if their project is in scope

fields.description:
If you go to a *Company managed project* > *Issues* > *click on any filter* and select *List view*, we don’t have an option to select the columns. (Refer to the attached screenshot.)

Having an option to select columns (as we have while searching for issues in the search bar or when using saved filters) will be much appreciated.
fields.summary: Option to add column

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Development panel showing on screen even though not connected to DVCS

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Open issue
 !image-2021-11-01-13-13-59-768.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Expected Results
Development panel shouldn't appear since it isn't connected to any DVCS

h3. Actual Results
Development panel appears on screen.

h3. Workaround
Clicking on the top right 'X' in the Development panel removes it from showing up in the future.
fields.summary: Development Panel showing on screen even though not connected to DVCS

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Attempting to delete a child issue of an Epic on the Structure plugin panel results in deleting the Epic itself rather than the Child
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Have Structure plugin installed
 # Have a structure with Epics and Stories linked to those epics
 # Click on an Epic with Child Issues (open issue details)
!image-2021-11-01-10-42-59-031.png|width=115,height=119!
 # Inside the Epic detail window, click the link for one of the children (stories)
!https://jira.atlassian.com/secure/temporaryattachment/9708ee523c4b36d6e6fba60d8cb7b45b0c3efa26/temp11418257016203123827_image-2021-11-01-10-41-43-993.png|width=181,height=440!


 # Observe that the name of the issue at the top of the window changes, but the issue icon and description does not
 # Delete the issue - observe that the warning message indicates you are about to delete the Epic, not the Child issue
!image-2021-11-01-10-44-09-680.png|width=197,height=98!



h3. Expected Results

Prompt to delete the Child issue
h3. Actual Results

The Epic is deleted
h3. Workaround

Use other options to delete the Story (Child of Epic), do not delete from the plugin panel
fields.summary: Attempting to delete a child issue of an Epic on the Structure plugin panel results in deleting the Epic itself rather than the child

fields.description:
Add the ability to track project elements such as components, versions, sprints, and other non-issue variables in dashboard gadgets.

As an example, a table that shows the components in each project of an instance.
fields.summary: Ability to have non-issue based gadgets

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

The activity streams gadget will show the update for the Epic link as "issue.field.issueparentassociation" rather than the field name. 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Update Epic link for any issue key
 # Check the update on Activity streams

h3. Expected Results

Activity stream should reflect the change as  "Epic Link" updated rather than field key.

h3. Actual Results

The update will be shown as below: 
 !Replicated issue.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround

Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Activity stream gadget will show the field key for Epic Link updates
Allow charts to be sorted in correct work flow status order

fields.description:
Can you freeze the column headings on the detail view of filter results? This feature works in Confluence Tables (and in Excel Spreadsheets for many years), it would be a nice usability addition.

No idea if I've got the component right, hope you can fix that. Thanks.
fields.summary: Freeze the column headings on filter results

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

A new issue has sprung up whereby users are getting their project notification page with a blank screen. In reality, the notification was set to null but why that happened seems to be unknown at the moment.

Running a test, it is not possible to remove a notification scheme that is associated with an active project. So, somehow the notification was set to null thus resorting to this issue.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Navigate to your *project settings > notifications*
# Click on the 'Action' button to use a different scheme
# Change to "None" and associate
 # The notification page appears with a blank screen

h3. Expected Results
The notification page should have a message which shows that "You are not using any notification scheme". Therefore there's nothing to display and the action button should be there to allow you to switch back.

h3. Actual Results

A project notification page appears with a white blank page
h3. Workaround
 # Navigate to [https://your-instance.atlassian.net/secure/project/SelectProjectScheme!default.jspa?projectId=10043]
 ** Where 10043 is your project key
 # Change from. "none" to any other notification scheme and click associate
fields.summary: Jira project notification page appearing with blank screen

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Typo on the error message related to execution limits on the Automation for Jira.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Have a rule aborted.
 # Check the error message.

h3. Expected Results

"Aborted...the rule was disabled, deleted or re-configured while it was running; or you may have reached you{color:#FF0000}*r*{color} execution limits"
h3. Actual Results

"Aborted...the rule was disabled, deleted or re-configured while it was running; or you may have reached you execution limits"
h3. Workaround

Keep calm and ignore the typo. :)
fields.summary: Typo on the error message related to execution limits on the Automation for Jira

fields.description:
h3. Problem Description
Application links on the bottom of the "Switch to" tab, below the "discover" section

h3. Suggested Solution
Display application links on the top of the "Switch to" tab
h3. Workaround
N/A
fields.summary: Display application links on the top of the "Switch to" tab

fields.description:
As a PO i need to be able to export the values/status of issues the date the sprint was finished to be able to make statistics from historical Sprints.

It is analogue to exporting the data you can see in a sprint report.
fields.summary: Export of the State of Issues at a certain date to Excel

fields.description:
Right now you can only link other issues upon the creation of a new issue.

After the issue is created, you have the option to add links to web links, Confluence pages, and other JIRA issues.
fields.summary: Ability to add a link to the Confluence service on the issue creation screen in JIRA

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

Currently, to change the outgoing email address, a Jira admin needs to update the address per project bases as described in [[https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiracloud/configuring-email-notifications-776636790.html]]. 

So, the Jira admin has to update the outgoing email address each time a new project is created. 

h3. Suggested Solution

Provide a feature on the SMTP mail configuration page accessible through */secure/admin/OutgoingMailServers.jspa* to apply the outgoing email address change for all current and newly created projects. 

h3. Why this is important
* More efficient. 
* Less time consuming. 
 
h3. Workaround 
For now the change is only made per project basis.
fields.summary: Provide the ability to change the outgoing email address through the SMTP mail configuration page

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

It is possible to provide work log less than 1 minute (e.g., .1 or 0.1 which equals 6 to seconds) during workflow transition. As a result Remaining Time will be decreased by 1 minute, however, work log has entry with empty timing.

View screen does not permit to enter work log less than 1 minute.

Transition/edit screen should not proceed if the inputted log work (time spent) value is less than 1.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Add "Time Tracking" field into "Edit issue" operation for a Screen Scheme for requires issue type.
 # Create issue with some time estimated (e.g. 1 Hour)
   !Create issue.png|thumbnail!
 # Edit issue and input "Time Spent" ".1" or "0.1"  
   !Update issue.png|thumbnail!
 # Check Remaining Time decreased by 1 minute   
   !All.png|thumbnail!
 # Under "Work Log" it is not showing how much time was logged   
   !Work-Log.png|thumbnail!
 # Look as old issue view, it is showing 6 seconds logged   
   !Old_Issue_View.png|thumbnail!  

h3. Expected Results

Jira should not allow input less than 1 minute or round up work log to minutes.
h3. Actual Results

Jira accepts work log values less than 1 minute via workflow transition.
h3. Workaround

Currently the only way to avoid is to use minutes as minimal entry. When providing Time Spent use units - m = minutes, h = hours and do not use decimal.
fields.summary: It is possible to input work log entry less than 1 minute during workflow transition

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Issue layout will show duplicate Development fields when the Development field is added to the applicable issue screen
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # In a company-managed project, access Project Settings > Issue layout
 # The default context fields will show as below:
 !image-2021-10-05-11-10-22-827.png|width=301,height=147!

 # Add the Development field to the applicable issue screen:
 !image-2021-10-05-11-11-39-560.png|width=149,height=282!
 # Issue layout will show duplicate Development fields (the one with the branch icon and the other with the icon used for custom fields)
 !image-2021-10-05-11-18-02-645.png|width=214,height=121!

h3. Expected Results

Showing just one field given that they apply to the same custom field (Development)
h3. Actual Results

Duplicate fields are shown
h3. Workaround

Not having the Development field as part of the screen. It will still be shown on the issue regardless of whether it is on the screen or not
fields.summary: Duplicate Development field in the Issue layout

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

After copying issue layout from the business project to the software project, *Development* panel disappear from the software project.

The business project doesn't have *Development* Panel available due to this feature request JRACLOUD-71637.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # In one of the business project, go to *Project settings* > I*ssue layout* > *Edit layout*
 # Click *Copy issue layout* and choose the software projects which share the same screen scheme with the business project
 # Click Next and confirm. 
 # Once the issue layout is copied , *Development* panel disappear from the software project.

h3. Expected Results

*Development* panel in the software project should not be affected by copying issue layout.
h3. Actual Results

*Development* panel disappear from the software project.
h3. Workaround

Contact Atlassian Support
fields.summary: Development panel disappear from the software project after copying issue layout from the business project to the software project

fields.description: It would be very useful to have an 'Assign to me' option in the people picker selector, or at least having the current user first in the list without the need to start typing for users to appear.
fields.summary: Add an 'Assign to me' option to the custom people picker

fields.description:
Announcment banner to be visble to all public (even when users do not have access to the site). This will enable administrators to direct users for access via a link in the banner or other informational text.  

 !image-2021-10-28-10-50-18-541.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Announcement banner public even when user does not have access to site

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Using the Jira New Navigation, the "Your Work" page shows a Recent projects section, which shows the recent projects you've worked on and their queues or boards (according to project type). If the recent queue is under the ITSM categories like Incidents, Changes, the link will redirect to the "All queues" section of the JSM project queues -- resulting in an incorrect queue shown.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a JSM project with the ITSM template and create some incidents or change tickets.
 # Go to the ITSM queues for Incidents or Changes to view the open tickets
# Go to "Your work" screen and click on one of the recent queues
# The link will open to a page saying the queue could not be found

 !Screen Shot 2021-10-28 at 09.43.56.png|thumbnail! 
 !image-2021-10-28-09-45-58-298.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Expected Results
The 'Recent Queue' links to the correct queue under the correct ITSM category

h3. Actual Results
The Recent Queue links to the wrong link, resulting in a page saying the queue could not be found
 !image-2021-10-28-09-45-58-298.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround
Currently, there is no known workaround for this behaviour. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Recent queue in "Your work" does not link to the correct queue for ITSM projects

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
If a ticket has been transitioned to a final state in its lifecycle, global transitions will fail to complete.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a global looping transition.
 # Create a ticket, close it and then reopen it.
 # Try to execute the global transition.

h3. Expected Results
The global transition should be executed fine.

h3. Actual Results
An error happens and in the console the error message is:
{noformat}
Illegal argument: requested new current step same as current step, but current step not specified
{noformat}

h3. Workaround
* Transition the ticket to another status and the transition the ticket back to the previous status.
fields.summary: Global looping transition fails once the ticket has been in a final state

fields.description:
h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create an automation rule based on any trigger.
# Add a "Then" statement to clone this issue into another JSM project.
# Add a "For all created issues" branch.
# Add a "Edit request type of this issue" function, to edit the clone's request type.

h3. Expected Results

The dropdown will display a list with the available request type for the clone/destination project.  

h3. Actual Results

No options will be displayed.

 !image-2021-10-27-17-20-44-260.png|thumbnail! 


h3.Workaround

No workaround at the moment.
fields.summary: Unable to set the request type for cloned issues within automation branches

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When trying to link a Confluence page with *|* (pipe) in the title to a Jira issue using the dropdown list, results in this error:
{quote}We're having trouble. Check your connection and try again.
{quote}
Verified that the I (pipe) becomes *%7C*
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Open an Issue > click on *Link Confluence page*
 # Use the dropdown list to select a Confluence page that contains | (pipe) in its title

h3. Expected Results

The page is linked.
h3. Actual Results

The pipe becomes %7C and it’s generate this error: "We're having trouble. Check your connection and try again."

!image-2021-10-27-16-24-19-174.png!
h3. Workaround
 # Use a different string which does not include the pipe character;
 # Copy the URL from Confluence and paste the link into the Jira issue instead of using the dropdown list.
 !image-2021-10-27-16-26-06-824.png! 
 !image-2021-10-27-16-26-30-612.png!
fields.summary: Error linking a Confluence page which contains | (pipe) in its title

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When clicking on the version link of the Jira Roadmap gadget, you're redirected to a bug page.
In the background, when navigating from project > releases, even though the link is the same, the gadget won't redirect you to the version details page.

h3. Steps to Reproduce

Described in [this video|https://share.getcloudapp.com/2NuPyKK8]
 # Create product versions with scheduled release dates in a software project
 # Create a dashboard and add the Jira Road Map gadget
 # Configure it to the given project
 # Click on the version name
 # You're redirected to a blank page with "version namesssssss to be here"

h3. Expected Results

To be redirected to the version's page

!image-2021-10-27-13-46-38-702.png|width=547,height=141!
h3. Actual Results

You'll be redirected to the bug page below
 !image-2021-10-27-13-34-42-956.png|width=547,height=141!
h3. Workaround

When clicking on the version page from the Roadmap gadget, press CTRL + click (or CMD + click for mac), or right-click and select open in a new tab.
fields.summary: Broken version links from Jira Roadmap Gadget

fields.description:
It is currently not possible to set the category (see below screenshot) when building a dashboard gadget in Jira Cloud.

!https://aws1.discourse-cdn.com/atlassiandeveloper/original/3X/b/c/bceda9edacfa6cff569c73e5715bfc61589a20e0.png|width=83,height=119!

 

The gadget is automatically added to the Jira category and that's the only option available so far.
fields.summary: When building a dashboard item (gadget), it should be possible to set the category (e.g. "Chart")

fields.description:
As of now, there is no way to differentiate between a built-in and a user-created custom field.

Having a way (tag/message/description) to differentiate between the two types will be quite useful.
fields.summary: Differentiation between built-in and user-created custom field

fields.description:
When we upload an attachment in the issue creation page in the description field, It doesn't provide the attachment preview.

It would be really helpful if we have a preview of the attachment during Issue creation in the description field.
fields.summary: Preview of attachment during Issue creation in description field

fields.description:
Jira is displaying a Discover on Apps button that shows some apps that can be used on our Jira.

Once we turned off the _Product Recommendation_ following this path: Jira settings > system > general configuration and select turn-off product recommendations at the bottom of the page, this stops showing other products in the "Switch-to" menu, but we still see Slack and discover products options. 

Current we can't hide Slack from the Discover section

 !Screenshot 2021-10-27 at 3.32.02 PM.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: As a Jira Administrator, I'd like to be able to hide "Slack" present under the Discover section

fields.description:
Problem definition:
Project Administrators cannot edit issue type scheme if it is assigned only to that specific project where the user is a project administrator.

Suggested Solution:
Extend the Project Administrators permissions to edit issue type scheme if it is assigned only to that specific project where the user is a project administrator.

Why is this important:
Allow project administration of issue types if the user is a Project Administrator.

Workaround:
Give Administration role on a global level.
fields.summary: Give Project Administrators permissions to edit issue type scheme

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

In a team managed project, while viewing a custom *label field* in a column on the *list view* of advance search results, the field shown multiple *None* values. 
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Add a custom field of type *label field* in a team managed project.
 # Go to *Advance issue search* and list an issue with the custom field.
 # Switch to *list view*.
 # *Add the column* to display the values of the newly added custom field.
 # The custom field list multiple *None* value in addition to the actual value.

h3. Expected Results

Only the current value of the field in the Jira issue should be displayed.
h3. Actual Results

Multiple None values are displayed.
 !Jira Listing Issue (1).png!
h3. Workaround


 Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Custom Label fields shows multiple None values in the list view

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Users can request the marketplace add-ons that are reviewed and rejected by the Admins.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Reject app request for one of the apps available on the welcome screen. For example, Microsoft Teams
# Invite a new user and inform to select Microsoft teams during the onboarding

h3. Expected Results
App requests should not be generated.

h3. Actual Results
App request will be created.

h3. Workaround

Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Users are able to request the marketplace add-ons that are reviewed and rejected

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

when you start a new line in the issue's description with '2' or '0' the issue view will transform it into a bullet
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # open an issue's description
 # type "2" or "0" then *space*

h3. Expected Results

"2" or "0" should stay in the field
h3. Actual Results

the number will be transformed into bullets
h3. Workaround

Edit the issue description on the old issue view

or, Use 'Undo' to restore the number.
fields.summary: Starting a new line with "2 " or "0 " in the issue's description on the new issue view will transform it into a bullet.

fields.description: It would be nice if we can edit some file formats within Jira as an attachment, similar to what can be done with Confluence when using the Atlassian Companion app. Also, it would be beneficial if the project admins can control the attachments access individually or by "group of attachments", similar to what Google drive manages files access.
fields.summary: Ability to edit JIRA issue attachments

fields.description:
To have the ability to hide the below fields in a Team-managed project would be beneficial as it will provide greater flexibility to the project administrators to customize their projects.
 * Attachment,
 * Linked Issues,
 * Issue,
 * Restrict To,
 * Flagged

Currently, those fields are not even visible in the Issue Layout screen.
fields.summary: Have the ability to hide certain fields in Team-managed projects

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Oftentimes users create rules to send web requests using tokens/keys in the authorization header. As tokens/keys act like passwords for accounts, this can bring security issues as those keys are exposed to other users in the instance that have access to the automation rules.

h3. Suggested Solution
Create a new section in automation where admins can create smart value variables to be used in any automation rule, where those values will be managed only by the users the admins allow.
fields.summary: As an admin, I want to be able to hide values in automation rules

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When using webhooks, defined in the app descriptor to catch some events happening in Jira. there is an issue with the user events. The host-based on the JWT coming from the request (using the Authorization parameter) for the issue events, but this doesn't work for the user events. 
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a connect app using JWT
 # trigger user-related events

h3. Expected Results

JWT that comes with a webhook registered by connect app for `user_created/user_updated/user_deleted` events should contain `sub` claim, which should have accountId of a user.
h3. Actual Results

JWT that comes with a webhook registered by connect app for `user_created/user_updated/user_deleted` events does not contain `sub` claim, which should have accountId of a user.
h3. Workaround

Currently, there is no known workaround for this behaviour. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: No sub claim in JWT when sending webhook for user_updated/created/deleted events

fields.description:
On the issue list of a project, when I type my search, let's say "amazing issue", If I'm not fast enough and my typing takes a break at "amaz", it launches a search, AND if in the meantime I continue to type, I lose focus on the field.
Sometimes it also triggers other actions like Edit, or Create Issue based on which key is typed on the keyboard while searching is launched in AJAX.

This is an awful experience each time I need to search an issue. I have to focus in a disproportionate way to make my search successful.

Would it be possible to improve this behaviour ? My opinion is that "a good old" ENTER should be the best to trigger the search. Or at least that we can choose the behaviour in the settings.
fields.summary: Make issue autosearch configurable

fields.description:
*Description*
The Create Epic dialog from Backlog allows configuring which fields are to be displayed. Unfortunately, these settings are forgotten the next time you want to create an epic.

*Steps to reproduce*

Create an Epic from the Backlog, set _Configure fields> Show Fields_ to "All"

*Actual Result*

The field configuration is empty and "All" fields need to be selected again. Even the Required fields are not displayed on the Epic Create screen.

*Expected Result*

The next time user creates an Epic from Backlog, the previous Field configuration should be remembered on the Create screen.
fields.summary: Creating Epic from Backlog, the create screen does not remember which fields should be displayed

fields.description:
As of now if the screens have too many workflows , then the page does not load from the top of the screen, users have to manually scroll to the top. It would be great if each page navigation is started from the top. This is the current behaviour of AtlasKit Table. 

h4.Steps to recreate
 # Navigate to Settings->Issues->Screens
 # Now navigate the pages on this screen.

h4.Expected behaviour
Each new page should start from the top of the screen.

h4.Actual Behaviour.
Users have to manually scroll to the top of the page if there are many workflows associated to a screen.
Refer the video recording attached in this ticket.
fields.summary: Improvement request for page navigation of Screens

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Web panel reloads every time the connect app does a PUT call

h3. Steps to Reproduce
- Download the Catalog app in a prod instance, or use https://tinaluo.atlassian.net/
- Go to an issue and click into the Catalog app web panel 
- Make some changes in the web panel
- You’ll see the app reloads every time a state update happens

h3. Expected Results
Web panel should not reload.

h3. Actual Results
Web panel reloads every time the connect app does a PUT call

h3. Workaround
 Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Web panel reloads every time the connect app does a PUT call

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
[AP.jira.openCreateIssueDialog] Random request type is selected instead of given issue type for JSM projects

https://community.developer.atlassian.com/t/ap-jira-opencreateissuedialog-random-request-type-is-selected-instead-of-given-issue-type-for-jsm-projects/50145

h3. Steps to Reproduce
Adjust IDs, use any JSM project ID and issue type ID, (e.g., *Task*), then open in console:
{code:none}
AP.jira.openCreateIssueDialog(console.log, { 
    pid: 10624,
    issueType: 10100,
    fields: { summary: "summary"}
})
{code}

h3. Expected Results
Create issue dialog with preselected project and *issuetype* = *Task* is opened

h3. Actual Results
Create issue dialog is open with preselected project but random request type

h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available

Video with bug for JSM projects: https://www.loom.com/share/d951c75b8bc949bd9281faffd6467def
Video with expected behaviour for JSW projects:  https://www.loom.com/share/5072db305a764dbc8df6cde9ccc1b5d4
fields.summary: [AP.jira.openCreateIssueDialog] Random request type is selected instead of given issue type for JSM projects

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

The help dropdown overlaps with the other segments when viewing on a smaller window.

This was noticed in the manage apps.

!image-2021-10-13-12-49-54-851.png|width=360,height=251!
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Reduce the window size of the browser.
 # Goto Manage apps.
 # Click on the help option (?)

h3. Expected Results

The dropdown should not overlap with other segments in the browser.
h3. Actual Results

The dropdown overlaps with other segments in the browser.
{noformat}
...
{noformat}
h3. Workaround

There is no workaround other than to view the window in the proper size.
fields.summary: The help dropdown overlaps with the other segments when viewing on a smaller window.

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Introduce 'My Organization' as a default sharing option for filters and dashboards
h3. Current

Navigate to System Settings > Default User Preferences > Default sharing for filters and dashboards. You may choose either Private or Public:

!image-2021-10-26-09-31-56-280.png|width=214,height=118!
h3. Proposed solution

Add 'My organization' as a default value
fields.summary: Add 'My Organization' as a default sharing option for filters and dashboards

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Typing a comment during a transition in the mobile iOS app makes the comment box move above the visible UI

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Open an issue on the mobile iOS app
 # Execute any transition
 # Try adding a comment

h3. Expected Results
Comment box stays visible and you can see what you're typing;

h3. Actual Results
Comment box is moved above visible user interface an is hidden anytime something is typed

h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Typing a comment during a transition in the mobile iOS app makes the comment box move above the visible UI

fields.description:
Jira Cloud does not currently provide a in product mechanism that would allow an admin to reset the site back to an empty site. Resetting a site is a common task as part of migration activities since many admins complete multiple dry runs prior to moving to production. This feature request is aimed at providing an in-app mechanism that allows for the content to be cleared gracefully without negatively affecting the users, groups, apps and licensing on a Jira Cloud instance. 

*As a workaround, we have the following options*:
 # Importing a blank site Jira import file
 # Reset all data on the site but [Unsubscribing/Resubscribing the Product|https://confluence.atlassian.com/cloudkb/reset-and-delete-all-data-from-your-cloud-site-691012037.html#:~:text=On%20your%20cloud%20site%2C%20go,DELETE%20into%20the%20field.]

h4. Notes on the available Workarounds
 * Importing a blank backup on the Jira side could potentially also wipe any connected Confluence users from the DB which would require the Organization to reimport Confluence users which may not be an option if Confluence is already in use in production. The only way to avoid this issue would be to select *Merge With Existing Users* which may not be an option depending on how a customer may need to reset the site. 
 !userOptions.png|thumbnail!

 * [Unsubcribing/resubscribing|https://confluence.atlassian.com/cloudkb/reset-and-delete-all-data-from-your-cloud-site-691012037.html] to the product can sometimes cause licensing issues (ECTL and other billing issues) and requires admins to engage with Migrations Support & CA Support to address. This can have the potential to affect/block production migrations.
 * Unsubscribing from the product also causes all downloaded apps to be reset - so in cases where there are many apps installed, admins have to manually re-install all of the plugins.
fields.summary: Provide a mechanism to wipe all Jira data from a given site

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Currently there is no DB Integrity Checker for JIRA Cloud leading to which Jira Cloud to Cloud migration becomes challenging.  Adding this tool will definitely help us in seamless migration and proactively identify issues of custom fields, missing configurations or configuration mis match.
fields.summary: DB Integrity Checker for JIRA Cloud

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
At the moment , when administrator configure automation with selecting two team managed project for multiple project scope , the issue type for issue field condition is not showing the correct issue type when scope = Multiple Projects
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create 2 team managed projects
 # Create Automation rule under Global automation configuration
# Set scope = Multiple Projects
# Select the 2 team managed projects created above.
# Select any trigger and action.
# Save the rule.
# Reload the screen
# Go back to the rule and add 'Issue Fields'Condition. Select Issue type.
# In the dropdown for value, the request types from the projects do not display.

h3. Expected Results
All the issue types from both team managed projects will be displayed.
h3. Actual Results
# Issue types from the team managed project
 !Screen Shot 2021-10-11 at 12.39.17 pm.png|thumbnail! 
# Rule details
 !Screen Shot 2021-10-11 at 12.39.03 pm.png|thumbnail! 
# Value of issue types not displayed
 !Screen Shot 2021-10-11 at 12.38.37 pm.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround
 Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Issue type value not displayed correctly in Issue field condition when selecting Multiple Projects scope in Automation scope configuration

Automation Web Request component, calling Rest API v3 Create Issue operation, does't accept the smart value {{issue.description.asJsonString}} in the Custom Data Body, to set the Description field, v2 does.

fields.description:
When {{webhookResponse.body}} is used in the automation rule *Log action* and if the response body is large, then the audit log doesn't fit to the page width and the users have to scroll horizontally to view the complete audit log.

It would be a better user experinece if the audit logs with webhook response can fit the page width so that users could view the entire log within the page and doesn't require scrolling.
fields.summary: Wrapping the large audit logs in Automation for Jira

fields.description:
It would be of great help towards avoiding duplication of custom fields being created if a user is shown the already created custom fields (in a pop-up window with hyperlink of those matching fields) in a Jira Cloud instance based on the field "name" and field "type" chosen at the "Create custom field" page. 

Have attached the screen where the pop-up window can be shown to the user based on the text entered in this step and the field type chosen in the previous step.
fields.summary: Display already available custom field based on the name and type of the new custom field

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Where there is no Notification Scheme associated to a Project, there is no way for the customer to re-associate a different Notification Scheme.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Open any Company managed project
 # Go to the Notification settings
 # On the Actions dropdown at the top-right select "Use a different scheme"
 # On the new page select "None" for the notification scheme
 # Confirm the changes
 # Go back to the Notifications section for the same Project

h3. Expected Results

At least the Actions dropdown should be present to allow the customer to re-associate a Notification Scheme
h3. Actual Results

The central Panel is completely empty which lefts the customer with no option to re-associate the Notification Scheme.
h3. Workaround
 # Find the Project Id for the affected project
 # modify the below URL with the proper instance name and Project ID:

[https://instancename.atlassian.net/secure/project/SelectProjectScheme!default.jspa?projectId=XXXXX]
fields.summary: When no Notification Scheme is associated to a Project, there is no way to associate a different Notification Scheme

fields.description:
As a heavy user of Jira automation for complex workflow interactions

I need to be able to enter comments for gadgets

so that when I need to review rules several months after I created them, I have the documentation built into the rule.
fields.summary: Create comments for automation gadgets

fields.description:
h3. Problem Statement:

When a new group or user is created, it's not possible for admins to give it the same permissions that an existing group/user is already granted.
h3. Suggested Solution:

It would be nice to have a feature where:
 * Admin can choose which group/user the newly added group/user will inherit permissions from.
 ** This could include: Permission schemes, Project Roles and Global Permissions
fields.summary: Add ability to mirror/copy a user or group's permissions

fields.description:
I understand that there is the tabs functionality in the issue view to group fields.

However, it would be great to be able to have custom sections in the right column instead of lumping them all into Details, More Fields & pinned.

It would be more efficient if we could add custom sections or labels..i.e. making a section for Due Dates, Resources, etc. as agents have become acclimated to the right column view for their essential fields, this would provide better organization.
fields.summary: Allow for more sections on the right column in the new issue view

fields.description:
How to search "Company Managed" and "Team Managed" projects through Advanced or Basic search? I think there is no such capability to search these type of projects presently. Project Type (Software, Business, Ops, etc.) field is not meant for this type of Project Categories.

 

Right now, one needs to either remember the Project Key or Project Name to search but even after searching how to find whether it is a "Company Managed" or "Team Managed" project?
fields.summary: Capability to search "Company Managed" or "Team Managed" projects

fields.description: Can we introduce a Slack and/or MS Teams logo as a hyperlink in the "View All Projects" screen and "Individual Project Board" screen if and only if a Jira project is integrated with Slack and/or MS Teams and a two-way communication has been configured? The hyperlink will take the user to the corresponding Channel page in Slack and/or MS Teams.
fields.summary: Slack/MS Teams logo as hyperlink on the "View All Projects" and Individual Project Board Screen

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Hovering over the username of an unmanaged account removed from the site shows an error

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Associate some content with a user. For example, assign an issue to the user.
# Remove the user from the site.
# Check the issue assigned to the user.
# Hover over the username

h3. Expected Results
There should be a helpful message indicating the user has been removed from the site.

h3. Actual Results

Hovering over the user name will show the below message.
 !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround

Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available.
fields.summary: Hovering over the username of an unmanaged account removed from the site shows an error

fields.description:
Hi, would be great if we could get more filter buttons on the Roadmap view, such as selecting a custom field we have created on Jira issues. Specifically on this view here, currently can only filter status categories, labels, and types. Would be excellent to have more options! Not sure the right component to select below, but please let me know if i can provide any more detail. 

!image-2021-10-21-12-57-50-715.png!
fields.summary: Add more filters to Roadmap view
Ability to pass values from checkbox field using the Create Variable option in Automation Rules

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

iOS / Android Picker for new photo / video does not generate same dimensions when media was inserted in the editor
h3. Steps to Reproduce

When a user takes anew photo / video to be insert into the Hybrid Editor the dimensions of the media card on iOS / Android differ. Android displays a big preview with the proper aspect ration where as iOS falls back to the default media card dimensions that crops the preview image.
h3. Expected Results

All platforms are aligned -> display the bigger preview with proper dimensions in the editor.
h3. Actual Results

Media dimensions are drastically different based on OS and OEM.  
h3. Workaround

iOS Would need to extract the metadata from the new image / video and forward this to the editor.
fields.summary: iOS / Android Picker for new photo / video does not generate same dimensions when media was inserted in the editor

fields.description: "+ Create" is available in Team Managed projects but not in Company Managed projects. See images attached.
fields.summary: Add "+ Create" to the columns in Company Managed projects
